definition: to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
small/tiny/few/young
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather
variant of 怪[guai4]

sentences.chinese: 这有什么好大惊小怪的？

sentences.english: That didn't stop Chinese pundits from making a fuss over it.
sentences.chinese: 这并没有阻止中国的博学之士对此大惊小怪。

sentences.english: To experienced software people, none of this is very surprising.
sentences.chinese: 有经验的软件人对此已经不觉得有啥大惊小怪的了。

sentences.english: The fact that my genius goes unrecognized saddens me, but no longer surprises.
sentences.chinese: 天赋得不到承认使我沮丧，但也使我不再大惊小怪。

sentences.english: Some of them were fussing, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有些孩子会大惊小怪。

sentences.english: Children seem to have endless desires, which shouldn't be a huge shock.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们总是要这要那的，不必为此大惊小怪。

sentences.english: She's always fussing about something or other.
sentences.chinese: 她对任何事情总是大惊小怪的。

sentences.english: It created a big fuss and the fuss persists to this day.
sentences.chinese: 它创造了一个大做文章，大惊小怪坚持到今天。

sentences.english: I said that a little too loudly, didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 大惊小怪的啊，一点也沉不住气。

sentences.english: Watch what happens all of you left wing alarmists and thugs.
sentences.chinese: 看看什么即将发生吧，你们这群大惊小怪的左翼混蛋。

sentences.english: He saw nothing remarkable in asking her to come down lower.
sentences.chinese: 他并不认为要求她屈就一些有什么可大惊小怪的。

sentences.english: You win and lose in football so there is no need to make any drama out of it.
sentences.chinese: 足球场上有赢也有输，没什么可大惊小怪的。

sentences.english: Don't make a fuss about such trifles.
sentences.chinese: 不要为区区小事而大惊小怪。

sentences.english: You shouldn't get all worked up over such a little thing.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该对这种芝麻小事大惊小怪的。

sentences.english: Don't make so much fuss over losing pen.
sentences.chinese: 别为了丢失踊支彼就这样大惊小怪。

definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
frightened/flustered
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
rare/strange
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
not to mind/unconcerned
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
unduly/excessive
to mind/to take offense
to care about/to mind
